column4: general question: How can I narrow the spacing of the stuff in the toolbars? For example, those using Terminal, "File" has 6 dropdown options (Open Terminal; Open Tab; New Profile; Close Tab; Close Window) . Between each option is much space. I'd like to "squish"  or have tighter line spacing. How can one do this?
much space? hmm - i have vrey little space. perhaps its your font setting set to a large font? or real small one?
you touched on another point: font size. I'd like to decrease both. Both spacing between the choices in the dropdown menus in all programs, and text size. How can this be done?
try the font preferance tool.  I tend to set mine very LARGE. :P
not that  i noticed. :P i tend to use 'grip' to rip cd's
you can unpack them from the terminal yes.
what command should i use to unpack more than one rar file at the same time?
unrar e whatevber.rar or the name of the first rar file of a multi rar archive
how do i know which is the first rar file? And if i put in the name of the first file, will the program automatically do the whole folder?
noirmally a multi-rar archive is named lilke foo.r01 foo.r02 foo.r03
or some variation of that.
yes. true.
so take a guess which is the first one. :P
actually, metzen said that the first one is the one with the ".rar" extension.
not from what ive seen.. but it can vary.   all the .rar ones ive seen are single rar archives.. but heck.. try them all :P
lok, metzen, how come the unrar command works in terminal. but the GUI program (Archive Manager) can't deal with it? Is there a way to do things with in the GUI?
the gui is just a front end - thats calling the terminal programs.. on mymachine the front end does work  at least in some cases.. it may be just missconfigured.
how do i configure the gui to work as well as the terminal?
no idea. i use the shell for such tasks.. it may be the gui cant handle multi-parts. never really worried about it.  im a shell kinda guy
i dont even have any rars to test with it right now
may want to check the ubuntu wikis
the faq mentiuons rars ---->> http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/FrequentlyAskedQuestions
did you use your email address on a website?
